intro: Solidago vulneraria, commonly known as the woundwort goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish to golden flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils in open woods, meadows, and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Solidago vulneraria is noted for its medicinal properties, historically used by indigenous peoples for its healing qualities.
